Testimony from Grant Ruckel: senior director of government affairs for Energy Transfer, stating that pipelines do not freeze and are naturally insulated, contradicting claims made by others about frozen gas infrastructure during the winter storm.
Statements from grid operators and Gover: including frozen wellheads and gas-fired power plants.
The technical complexity of the question: with oil and gas pipeline experts agreeing that even sustained freezing temperatures in Texas would not freeze gas in pipelines the same way water would.
The fact that pipelines are buried benea: providing a natural insulation that helps prevent freezing.
